title: Replication-Ready Text Analysis Pipeline
code: library(krpoltext)  ps <- load_party_statements() ps_sub <- get_docs("party_statements", year = 2010:2022, .data = ps)  cat("Documents:", nrow(ps_sub), "\n") cat("Years:", paste(range(ps_sub$year), collapse = "-"), "\n")

title: Replication-Ready Text Analysis Pipeline
code: library(quanteda)  corp <- as_quanteda_corpus(ps_sub, docid_field = "id") docvars(corp) |> head()

title: Replication-Ready Text Analysis Pipeline
text: filtered column already contains morphologically parsed Korean text (via khaiii). can use directly tokenize raw text column:
code: toks <- tokens(corp, remove_punct = TRUE, remove_numbers = TRUE) dfm_ps <- dfm(toks) dfm_ps

title: Replication-Ready Text Analysis Pipeline
code: topfeatures(dfm_ps, 20)  # By partisan group dfm_group <- dfm_group(dfm_ps, groups = partisan) topfeatures(dfm_group, 10, groups = TRUE)

title: Replication-Ready Text Analysis Pipeline
code: library(quanteda.textstats)  dfm_binary <- dfm_group(dfm_ps, groups = conservative) keyness <- textstat_keyness(dfm_binary, target = "1") head(keyness, 20)

title: Replication-Ready Text Analysis Pipeline
code: cb <- load_campaign_booklet() cb_assembly <- get_docs(   "campaign_booklet",   office = "national_assembly",   .data = cb )  corp_cb <- as_quanteda_corpus(cb_assembly, docid_field = "code") dfm_cb <- corp_cb |>   tokens(remove_punct = TRUE) |>   dfm()  # Compare by election result dfm_result <- dfm_group(dfm_cb, groups = result) topfeatures(dfm_result, 10, groups = TRUE)

code: saveRDS(dfm_ps, "dfm_party_statements_2010_2022.rds")

title: Data Dictionary
text: Official election campaign booklets (공보물) 49,678 individual candidates across presidential, National Assembly, local elections South Korea (2000–2022). Text extracted via OCR (black--white, page--page using Google Drive API) parsed using khaiii Korean morphological analyzer.

title: Data Dictionary
text: Missing values: 2,283 candidates lack booklet; 151 missing biographical information. 23 booklets unprocessable (corrupted files). See paper Section “Methods” details. Identifiers: code uniquely identifies document. job_id edu_id vary across election years; use job_code edu_code consistent cross-year analysis. Caution Basic Assembly: Basic Assembly booklets lower average word counts, potentially due lower PDF quality genuinely shorter texts. See paper discussion. filtered: Morphologically parsed using khaiii; retains Korean content words.

title: Data Dictionary
text: Official statements party spokespersons minutes daily leadership meetings South Korea’s two major political parties (2003–2022): center-left Progressive Party (현 더불어민주당) center-right Conservative Party (현 국민의힘). Total: 82,723 statements (35,115 conservative + 42,335 progressive; see paper Table 9 yearly breakdown).

title: Data Dictionary
text: Missing values: fields may contain NA empty strings. Party name changes: parties undergone frequent name changes (see paper Table 3). partisan column uses stable ideological labels rather party names. filtered: Morphologically parsed using khaiii; retains Korean content words.

title: Data Dictionary
text: text UTF-8 encoded Korean. text contains full original text; filtered contains parsed version suitable direct text analysis. complete data provenance, OCR methodology, technical validation, use case examples, see Data Descriptor: https://doi.org/10.1038/s41597-025-05220-4 Supplementary Information (party name mappings, example analyses): available paper’s supplementary materials.
